article: fast-rising pension costs for government employees -- the issue that helped set off this week 's transit strike in new york city -- is a problem confronting cities , counties and states nationwide , causing many budgetary experts to predict a wave of painful fights over efforts to scale back government retirement programs .
abstract: transit strike reflects nationwide pension woes
